name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
synopsis: A novel of warmth and humor, despite dealing with serious issues like racial injustice and the loss of innocence, set in the Deep South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
synopsis: A chilling portrayal of a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance, censorship, and propaganda to control every aspect of life.

name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
synopsis: A tale of the American dream gone wrong, set in the Jazz Age and following the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the elusive Daisy Buchanan.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
synopsis: A romantic novel exploring the complexities of love, marriage, and society, centered on Elizabeth Bennet and the proud Mr. Darcy.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
synopsis: A young hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, embarks on a journey to help a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland from a dragon, encountering dangers and treasures along the way.

name: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
synopsis: The obsessive quest of Captain Ahab to hunt the white whale Moby Dick, exploring themes of fate, revenge, and the natural world.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
synopsis: A young man named Holden Caulfield reflects on his life, identity, and the disillusionment of adulthood as he navigates his teenage years in New York City.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
synopsis: The first book in the epic Lord of the Rings trilogy, following Frodo Baggins as he begins his perilous journey to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
synopsis: A young boy named Harry Potter discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he uncovers a dark secret about his past.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
synopsis: A dystopian novel set in a future society where humans are engineered and conditioned for specific roles, exploring themes of conformity, technology, and individuality.
